GET("http://www.colourlovers.com/api/color/6B4106?format=json") #> Response [http://www.colourlovers.com/api/color/6B4106?format=json] #>   Date: 2023-05-08 15:11 #>   Status: 403 #>   Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 #>   Size: 6.16 kB #> <!DOCTYPE html> #> <html lang="en-US"> #> <head> #>     <title>Just a moment...</title> #>     <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"> #>     <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=Edge"> #>     <meta name="robots" content="noindex,nofollow"> #>     <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"> #>     <link href="/cdn-cgi/styles/challenges.css" rel="stylesheet"> #>      #> ... http_type(resp) #> [1] "application/json" github_api <- function(path) {   url <- modify_url("https://api.github.com", path = path)      resp <- GET(url)   if (http_type(resp) != "application/json") {     stop("API did not return json", call. = FALSE)   }      resp } github_api <- function(path) {   url <- modify_url("https://api.github.com", path = path)      resp <- GET(url)   if (http_type(resp) != "application/json") {     stop("API did not return json", call. = FALSE)   }      jsonlite::fromJSON(content(resp, "text"), simplifyVector = FALSE) }

what: Turn API errors into R errors
title: Best practices for API packages
text: Next, need make sure API wrapper throws error request failed. Using web API introduces additional possible points failure R code aside occurring R . include: Client-side exceptions Network / communication exceptions Server-side exceptions need make sure converted regular R errors. can figure ’s problem http_error(), checks HTTP status code. Status codes 400 range usually mean ’ve done something wrong. Status codes 500 range typically mean something gone wrong server side. Often API provide information error body response: use available. API returns special errors common problems, might want provide detail error. example, run requests rate limited might want tell user long wait can make next request (even automatically wait long!). poorly written APIs return different types response based whether request succeeded failed. API ’ll need make request function check status_code() parsing response. many APIs, common approach retry API calls return something 500 range. However, , ’s extremely important make sure form exponential backoff: something’s wrong server-side, hammering server retries may make things worse, may lead exhausting quota (hitting sorts rate limits). common policy retry 5 times, starting 1s, time doubling adding small amount jitter (plus minus , say, 5% current wait time).
code: github_api <- function(path) {   url <- modify_url("https://api.github.com", path = path)      resp <- GET(url)   if (http_type(resp) != "application/json") {     stop("API did not return json", call. = FALSE)   }      parsed <- jsonlite::fromJSON(content(resp, "text"), simplifyVector = FALSE)      if (http_error(resp)) {     stop(       sprintf(         "GitHub API request failed [%s]\n%s\n<%s>",          status_code(resp),         parsed$message,         parsed$documentation_url       ),       call. = FALSE     )   }      structure(     list(       content = parsed,       path = path,       response = resp     ),     class = "github_api"   ) } github_api("/user/hadley") #> Error: GitHub API request failed [404] #> Not Found #> <https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/users#get-a-user>

title: Best practices for API packages
text: ’re function, ’s one important header set every API wrapper: user agent. user agent string used identify client. useful API owner allows see using API. ’s also useful contact inside often makes easier pull requests logs see ’s going wrong. ’re hitting commercial API, also makes easier internal R advocates see many people using API via R hopefully assign resources. good default R API package wrapper make URL GitHub repo:
code: ua <- user_agent("http://github.com/hadley/httr") ua #> <request> #> Options: #> * useragent: http://github.com/hadley/httr  github_api <- function(path) {   url <- modify_url("https://api.github.com", path = path)      resp <- GET(url, ua)   if (http_type(resp) != "application/json") {     stop("API did not return json", call. = FALSE)   }      parsed <- jsonlite::fromJSON(content(resp, "text"), simplifyVector = FALSE)      if (status_code(resp) != 200) {     stop(       sprintf(         "GitHub API request failed [%s]\n%s\n<%s>",          status_code(resp),         parsed$message,         parsed$documentation_url       ),       call. = FALSE     )   }      structure(     list(       content = parsed,       path = path,       response = resp     ),     class = "github_api"   ) }

Many APIs use just one forms argument passing, others use multiple combination. Best practice insulate user various arguments used API instead simply expose relevant arguments via R function arguments, might used URL, headers, body, etc. parameter small fixed set possible values allowed API, can use list default arguments use match.arg() ensure caller supplies one values. (also allows user supply short unique prefixes.) good practice explicitly set default values arguments required NULL. default value, first one listed vector allowed arguments.

title: Best practices for API packages
text: Many APIs can called without authentication (just called web browser). However, others require authentication perform particular requests avoid rate limits limitations. common forms authentication OAuth HTTP basic authentication: “Basic” authentication: requires username password (sometimes just username). passed part HTTP request. httr, can : GET("http://httpbin.org", authenticate("username", "password")) Basic authentication API key: alternative provided many APIs API “key” “token” passed part request. better username/password combination can regenerated independent username password. API key can specified number different ways: URL query argument, HTTP header Authorization header, argument inside request body. OAuth: OAuth protocol generating user- session-specific authentication token use subsequent requests. (early standard, OAuth 1.0, terribly common . See oauth1.0_token() details.) current OAuth 2.0 standard common modern web apps. involves round trip client server establish API client authority access data. See oauth2.0_token(). ’s ok publish app ID app “secret” - actually important security user data. APIs describe authentication processes inaccurately, care needs taken understand true authentication mechanism regardless label used API docs. possible specify key(s) token(s) required basic OAuth authentication number different ways. may also need way preserve user credentials function calls end users need specify time. good start use environment variable. example write function checks presence GitHub personal access token errors otherwise:
code: github_pat <- function() {   pat <- Sys.getenv('GITHUB_PAT')   if (identical(pat, "")) {     stop("Please set env var GITHUB_PAT to your github personal access token",       call. = FALSE)   }    pat }

title: Best practices for API packages
text: Many APIs rate limited, means can send certain number requests per hour. Often request rate limited, error message tell long wait performing another request. might want expose user, even include call Sys.sleep() waits long enough. example, implement rate_limit() function tells many calls github API available . getting first version working, ’ll often want polish output user friendly. example, can parse unix timestamps useful date types.
code: rate_limit <- function() {   github_api("/rate_limit") } rate_limit() #> <GitHub /rate_limit> #> List of 2 #>  $ resources:List of 4 #>   ..$ core                :List of 5 #>   .. ..$ limit    : int 60 #>   .. ..$ remaining: int 56 #>   .. ..$ reset    : int 1683562276 #>   .. ..$ used     : int 4 #>   .. ..$ resource : chr "core" #>   ..$ graphql             :List of 5 #>   .. ..$ limit    : int 0 #>   .. ..$ remaining: int 0 #>   .. ..$ reset    : int 1683562278 #>   .. ..$ used     : int 0 #>   .. ..$ resource : chr "graphql" #>   ..$ integration_manifest:List of 5 #>   .. ..$ limit    : int 5000 #>   .. ..$ remaining: int 5000 #>   .. ..$ reset    : int 1683562278 #>   .. ..$ used     : int 0 #>   .. ..$ resource : chr "integration_manifest" #>   ..$ search              :List of 5 #>   .. ..$ limit    : int 10 #>   .. ..$ remaining: int 10 #>   .. ..$ reset    : int 1683558738 #>   .. ..$ used     : int 0 #>   .. ..$ resource : chr "search" #>  $ rate     :List of 5 #>   ..$ limit    : int 60 #>   ..$ remaining: int 56 #>   ..$ reset    : int 1683562276 #>   ..$ used     : int 4 #>   ..$ resource : chr "core" rate_limit <- function() {   req <- github_api("/rate_limit")   core <- req$content$resources$core    reset <- as.POSIXct(core$reset, origin = "1970-01-01")   cat(core$remaining, " / ", core$limit,     " (Resets at ", strftime(reset, "%H:%M:%S"), ")\n", sep = "") }  rate_limit() #> 56 / 60 (Resets at 16:11:16)

title: Getting started with httr
text: goal document get running httr quickly possible. httr designed map closely underlying http protocol. ’ll try explain basics intro, ’d also recommend “HTTP: Protocol Every Web Developer Must Know” “HTTP made really easy”. vignette (parts httr API) derived excellent “Requests quickstart guide” Kenneth Reitz. Requests python library similar spirit httr. two important parts http: request, data sent server, response, data sent back server. first section, ’ll learn basics constructing request accessing response. second third sections, ’ll dive details .

title: Getting started with httr
text: make request, first load httr, call GET() url: gives response object. Printing response object gives useful information: actual url used (redirects), http status, file (content) type, size, ’s text file, first lines output. can pull important parts response various helper methods, dig directly object: ’ll use httpbin.org throughout introduction. accepts many types http request returns json describes data received. makes easy see httr . well GET(), can also use HEAD(), POST(), PATCH(), PUT() DELETE() verbs. ’re probably familiar GET() POST(): GET() used browser requesting page, POST() (usually) used submitting form server. PUT(), PATCH() DELETE() used often web APIs.
code: library(httr) r <- GET("http://httpbin.org/get") r status_code(r) headers(r) str(content(r))

title: Getting started with httr
text: data sent back server consists three parts: status line, headers body. important part status line http status code: tells whether request successful. ’ll show access data, access body headers.

title: Getting started with httr
text: status code three digit number summarises whether request successful (defined server ’re talking ). can access status code along descriptive message using http_status(): successful request always returns status 200. Common errors 404 (file found) 403 (permission denied). ’re talking web APIs might also see 500, generic failure code (thus helpful). ’d like learn , memorable guides http status cats. can automatically throw warning raise error request succeed: highly recommend using one functions whenever ’re using httr inside function (.e. interactively) make sure find errors soon possible.
code: r <- GET("http://httpbin.org/get") # Get an informative description: http_status(r)  # Or just access the raw code: r$status_code warn_for_status(r) stop_for_status(r)

title: Getting started with httr
text: three ways access body request, using content(): content(r, "text") accesses body character vector: httr automatically decode content server using encoding supplied content-type HTTP header. Unfortunately can’t always trust server tells , can override encoding needed: ’re problems figuring correct encoding , try stringi::stri_enc_detect(content(r, "raw")). non-text requests, can access body request raw vector: exactly sequence bytes web server sent, highest fidelity way saving files disk: httr provides number default parsers common file types: See ?content complete list. convenient interactive usage, ’re writing API wrapper, ’s best parse text raw content check expect. See API wrappers vignette details.
code: r <- GET("http://httpbin.org/get") content(r, "text") content(r, "text", encoding = "ISO-8859-1") content(r, "raw") bin <- content(r, "raw") writeBin(bin, "myfile.txt") # JSON automatically parsed into named list str(content(r, "parsed"))

title: Getting started with httr
text: Like response, request consists three pieces: status line, headers body. status line defines http method (GET, POST, DELETE, etc) url. can send additional data server url (query string), headers (including cookies) body POST(), PUT() PATCH() requests.

title: Getting started with httr
text: common way sending simple key-value pairs server query string: e.g. http://httpbin.org/get?key=val. httr allows provide arguments named list query argument. example, wanted pass key1=value1 key2=value2 http://httpbin.org/get : NULL elements automatically dropped list, keys values escaped automatically.
code: r <- GET("http://httpbin.org/get",    query = list(key1 = "value1", key2 = "value2") ) content(r)$args r <- GET("http://httpbin.org/get",    query = list(key1 = "value 1", "key 2" = "value2", key2 = NULL)) content(r)$args

title: Getting started with httr
text: can add custom headers request add_headers(): (Note content(r)$header retrieves headers httpbin received. headers(r) gives headers sent back response.)
code: r <- GET("http://httpbin.org/get", add_headers(Name = "Hadley")) str(content(r)$headers)

title: Getting started with httr
text: Cookies simple key-value pairs like query string, persist across multiple requests session (’re sent back forth every time). send cookies server, use set_cookies(): Note response includes b cookies added server earlier.
code: r <- GET("http://httpbin.org/cookies", set_cookies("MeWant" = "cookies")) content(r)$cookies

title: Getting started with httr
text: POST()ing, can include data body request. httr allows supply number different ways. common way named list: can use encode argument determine data sent server: see exactly ’s sent server, use verbose(). Unfortunately due way verbose() works, knitr can’t capture messages, ’ll need run interactive console see ’s going . PUT() PATCH() can also request bodies, take arguments identically POST(). can also send files disk: (upload_file() guess mime-type extension - using type argument override/supply .) uploads stream data server: data loaded R chunks sent remote server. means can upload files larger memory. See POST() details types thing can send: body, empty body, character raw vectors.
code: r <- POST("http://httpbin.org/post", body = list(a = 1, b = 2, c = 3)) url <- "http://httpbin.org/post" body <- list(a = 1, b = 2, c = 3)  # Form encoded r <- POST(url, body = body, encode = "form") # Multipart encoded r <- POST(url, body = body, encode = "multipart") # JSON encoded r <- POST(url, body = body, encode = "json") POST(url, body = body, encode = "multipart", verbose()) # the default POST(url, body = body, encode = "form", verbose()) POST(url, body = body, encode = "json", verbose()) POST(url, body = upload_file("mypath.txt")) POST(url, body = list(x = upload_file("mypath.txt")))

title: Managing secrets

code: library(openssl) library(jsonlite) library(curl)  encrypt <- function(secret, username) {   url <- paste("https://api.github.com/users", username, "keys", sep = "/")    resp <- httr::GET(url)   httr::stop_for_status(resp)   pubkey <- httr::content(resp)[[1]]$key    opubkey <- openssl::read_pubkey(pubkey)   cipher <- openssl::rsa_encrypt(charToRaw(secret), opubkey)   jsonlite::base64_enc(cipher) }    cipher <- encrypt("<username>\n<password>", "hadley") cat(cipher) decrypt <- function(cipher, key = openssl::my_key()) {   cipherraw <- jsonlite::base64_dec(cipher)   rawToChar(openssl::rsa_decrypt(cipherraw, key = key)) }  decrypt(cipher) #> username #> password

title: Tools for Working with URLs and HTTP
text: httr superseded: changes necessary keep CRAN made. recommend using httr2 instead. aim httr provide wrapper curl package, customised demands modern web APIs. Key features: Functions important http verbs: GET(), HEAD(), PATCH(), PUT(), DELETE() POST(). Automatic connection sharing across requests website (default, curl handles managed automatically), cookies maintained across requests, --date root-level SSL certificate store used. Requests return standard reponse object captures http status line, headers body, along useful information. Response content available content() raw vector (=   "raw"), character vector (= "text"), parsed R object (= "parsed"), currently html, xml, json, png jpeg. can convert http errors R errors stop_for_status(). Config functions make easier modify request common ways: set_cookies(), add_headers(), authenticate(), use_proxy(), verbose(), timeout(), content_type(), accept(), progress(). Support OAuth 1.0 2.0 oauth1.0_token() oauth2.0_token(). demo directory eight OAuth demos: four 1.0 (twitter, vimeo, withings yahoo) four 2.0 (facebook, github, google, linkedin). OAuth credentials automatically cached within project. httr wouldn’t possible without hard work authors curl libcurl. Thanks! httr inspired http libraries languages, Resty, Requests httparty.

code: # Never cached, always causes redownload r1 <- GET("https://www.google.com") cache_info(r1) #> <cache_info>  https://www.google.com/ #>   Cacheable:     TRUE #>   Expires:       Mon, 08 May 2023 15:10:52 GMT <expired> #>   Last-Modified:  #>   Etag:           r1$date #> [1] "2023-05-08 15:10:52 GMT" rerequest(r1)$date #> [1] "2023-05-08 15:10:52 GMT"  # Expires in a year r2 <- GET("https://www.google.com/images/srpr/logo11w.png") cache_info(r2) #> <cache_info>  https://www.google.com/images/srpr/logo11w.png #>   Cacheable:     TRUE #>   Expires:       Tue, 07 May 2024 15:10:52 GMT #>   Last-Modified: Tue, 22 Oct 2019 18:30:00 GMT #>   Etag:           r2$date #> [1] "2023-05-08 15:10:52 GMT" rerequest(r2)$date #> [1] "2023-05-08 15:10:52 GMT"  if (FALSE) { # Has last-modified and etag, so does revalidation r3 <- GET("http://httpbin.org/cache") cache_info(r3) r3$date rerequest(r3)$date  # Expires after 5 seconds r4 <- GET("http://httpbin.org/cache/5") cache_info(r4) r4$date rerequest(r4)$date Sys.sleep(5) cache_info(r4) rerequest(r4)$date }

title: Install or uninstall a callback function — get_callback
code: if (FALSE) { ## Log all HTTP requests to the screeen req_logger <- function(req) {   cat("HTTP request to", sQuote(req$url), "\n") }  old <- set_callback("request", req_logger) g1 <- GET("https://httpbin.org") g2 <- GET("https://httpbin.org/ip") set_callback("request", old)  ## Log all HTTP requests and response status codes as well req_logger2 <- function(req) {   cat("HTTP request to", sQuote(req$url), "... ") } res_logger <- function(req, res) {   cat(res$status_code, "\n") }  old_req <- set_callback("request", req_logger2) old_res <- set_callback("response", res_logger) g3 <- GET("https://httpbin.org") g4 <- GET("https://httpbin.org/ip") set_callback("request", old_req) set_callback("response", old_res)  ## Return a recorded response, without performing the HTTP request replay <- function(req) {   if (req$url == "https://httpbin.org") g3 } old_req <- set_callback("request", replay) grec <- GET("https://httpbin.org") grec$date == g3$date set_callback("request", old_req) }

Use oauth1.0_token() oauth2.0_token() get user tokens, sign_oauth1.0() sign_oauth2.0() sign requests. demos directory twelve demos using OAuth: four 1.0 (linkedin, twitter, vimeo, yahoo) eight 2.0 (azure, facebook, github, google, linkedin, reddit, yahoo, yelp).

text: See demos use.

code: init_oauth1.0(   endpoint,   app,   permission = NULL,   is_interactive = interactive(),   private_key = NULL )

title: Retrieve OAuth 1.0 access token. — init_oauth1.0
text: endpoint OAuth endpoint, created oauth_endpoint() app OAuth consumer application, created oauth_app() permission optional, string permissions ask . is_interactive DEPRECATED private_key Optional, key provided openssl::read_key(). Used signed OAuth 1.0.

title: Retrieve OAuth 2.0 access token. — init_oauth2.0
text: See demos use.

title: Retrieve OAuth 2.0 access token. — init_oauth2.0
code: init_oauth2.0(   endpoint,   app,   scope = NULL,   user_params = NULL,   type = NULL,   use_oob = getOption("httr_oob_default"),   oob_value = NULL,   is_interactive = interactive(),   use_basic_auth = FALSE,   config_init = list(),   client_credentials = FALSE,   query_authorize_extra = list() )  oauth2.0_authorize_url(   endpoint,   app,   scope,   redirect_uri = app$redirect_uri,   state = nonce(),   query_extra = list() )  oauth2.0_access_token(   endpoint,   app,   code,   user_params = NULL,   type = NULL,   use_basic_auth = FALSE,   redirect_uri = app$redirect_uri,   client_credentials = FALSE,   config = list() )

title: Retrieve OAuth 2.0 access token. — init_oauth2.0
text: endpoint OAuth endpoint, created oauth_endpoint() app OAuth consumer application, created oauth_app() scope character vector scopes request. user_params Named list holding endpoint specific parameters pass server posting request obtaining refreshing access token. type content type used override incorrect server response use_oob FALSE, use local webserver OAuth dance. Otherwise, provide URL user prompt validation code. Defaults "httr_oob_default" default, TRUE httpuv installed. oob_value provided, specifies value use redirect_uri parameter retrieving authorization URL. Defaults "urn:ietf:wg:oauth:2.0:oob". Requires use_oob = TRUE. is_interactive DEPRECATED use_basic_auth TRUE use http basic authentication retrieve token. authorization servers require . FALSE, default, retrieve token including app key secret request body. config_init Additional configuration settings sent POST(), e.g. user_agent(). client_credentials Default FALSE. Set TRUE use Client Credentials Grant instead Authorization Code Grant. See https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6749#section-4.4. query_authorize_extra Default list(). Set named list holding query parameters append initial auth page query. Useful APIs. query_extra See query_authorize_extra

what: Generate a JWT signature given credentials. — jwt_signature
title: Generate a JWT signature given credentials. — jwt_signature
text: described https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2/service-account

title: Generate a JWT signature given credentials. — jwt_signature
code: jwt_signature(   credentials,   scope,   aud,   sub = NULL,   iat = as.integer(Sys.time()),   exp = iat + duration,   duration = 60L * 60L )

title: Generate a JWT signature given credentials. — jwt_signature
text: credentials Parsed contents credentials file. scope space-delimited list permissions application requests. aud descriptor intended target assertion. typically comes service auth file. sub email address user application requesting delegated access. iat time assertion issued, measured seconds since 00:00:00 UTC, January 1, 1970. exp expiration time assertion, measured seconds since 00:00:00 UTC, January 1, 1970. value maximum 1 hour issued time. duration Duration token, seconds. iss Email address client_id application making access token request.

title: Generate a JWT signature given credentials. — jwt_signature
code: if (FALSE) { cred <- jsonlite::fromJSON("~/Desktop/httrtest-45693cbfac92.json") jwt_signature(cred, "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.profile") }

code: oauth2.0_token(   endpoint,   app,   scope = NULL,   user_params = NULL,   type = NULL,   use_oob = getOption("httr_oob_default"),   oob_value = NULL,   as_header = TRUE,   use_basic_auth = FALSE,   cache = getOption("httr_oauth_cache"),   config_init = list(),   client_credentials = FALSE,   credentials = NULL,   query_authorize_extra = list() )

title: Generate an oauth2.0 token. — oauth2.0_token
text: endpoint OAuth endpoint, created oauth_endpoint() app OAuth consumer application, created oauth_app() scope character vector scopes request. user_params Named list holding endpoint specific parameters pass server posting request obtaining refreshing access token. type content type used override incorrect server response use_oob FALSE, use local webserver OAuth dance. Otherwise, provide URL user prompt validation code. Defaults "httr_oob_default" default, TRUE httpuv installed. oob_value provided, specifies value use redirect_uri parameter retrieving authorization URL. Defaults "urn:ietf:wg:oauth:2.0:oob". Requires use_oob = TRUE. as_header TRUE, default, configures token add bearer header subsequent requests. FALSE, configures token add url parameter subsequent requests. use_basic_auth TRUE use http basic authentication retrieve token. authorization servers require . FALSE, default, retrieve token including app key secret request body. cache logical value string. TRUE means cache using default cache file .httr-oauth, FALSE means cache, NA means guess using sensible heuristics. string means use specified path cache file. config_init Additional configuration settings sent POST(), e.g. user_agent(). client_credentials Default FALSE. Set TRUE use Client Credentials Grant instead Authorization Code Grant. See https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6749#section-4.4. credentials Advanced use : allows completely customise token generation. query_authorize_extra Default list(). Set named list holding query parameters append initial auth page query. Useful APIs.

httr 1.4.6
text: Supress use httpbin examples tests become unreliable.

title: httr 1.4.5
text: CRAN release: 2023-02-24 internal helper checks interactive session OOB flow now honors "rlang_interactive" global option, case ’s necessary declare session interactive (enough) OOB (@jennybc, #734).

title: httr 1.4.4
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-17 Fix intermittent failing test.

title: httr 1.4.3
text: CRAN release: 2022-05-03 Fix failing test.

title: httr 1.4.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-07-20 Fix failing test. parse_url() now refers RFC3986 parsing URL’s scheme, bit permissive syntax (@ymarcon, #615).

title: httr 1.4.1
text: CRAN release: 2019-08-05 Remove default cainfo option Windows. Providing CA bundle needed anymore curl now uses native schannel SSL backend. recent versions libcurl, overriding CA bundle actually breaks custom trust certificates corporate networks. (@jeroen, #603) http_status() now throws correct error message http status code list known codes (@Javdat, #567). POST() gains example use encode = "raw" specific json string body (@cderv, #563) RETRY() now throws correct error message error occurs request (@austin3dickey, #581). VERB() RETRY() now automatically uppercase methods (@patr1ckm, #571).

title: httr 1.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-12-11

title: httr 1.4.0
text: OAuth2.0 made somewhat flexible order support websites: init_oauth2.0() passes use_basic_auth onwards, enabling basic authentication OAuth 2.0 (@peterhartman, #484). oauth2.0_token() (init_oauth2.0()) gains oob_value argument allows arbitrary values sent request_uri parameter OOB flows (@ctrombley, #493). oauth2.0_token() (init_oauth2.0()) gain new query_authorize_extra parameter make possible add extra query parameters authorization URL. needed APIs (e.g. fitbit) (@cosmomeese, #503). oauth_endpoints() contains updated urls Yahoo (@ctrombley, #493) Vimeo (#491). OAuth 2.0 token refresh gives informative error fails (#516). Prior token retrieval -disk cache, scopes de-duplicated, sorted, stripped names hashed. eliminates source hash mismatch causes new tokens requested, even existing tokens necessary scope. (@jennybc, #495) Updates demos: Facebook OAuth demo now uses device flow (#510). allows continue using FB api R new security policy. new Noun Project demo shows use one-legged OAuth1 (@cderv, #548). Vimeo demo updated OAuth 1.0 2.0 (#491).

title: httr 1.4.0
text: cache_info() now handles un-named flags, illustrated “private” server returns “private, max-age = 0”. parse_http_date() gets better default value failure argument reponses unparseable dates can printed without error (@shrektan, #544). POST() now uses 22 digits precision body list elements default (@jmwerner, #490) RETRY() now terminates successful request, regardless value terminate_on. return previous behaviour, set terminate_on_success = FALSE (#522). RETRY() VERB(), HEAD requests now succeed (#478, #499). Encoding falls back UTF-8 supplied content-type parsing fails (#500). Non-http(s) headers longer parsed (@billdenney, #537). makes possible use httr protocols http, although advised, ’re .

title: httr 1.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2017-08-20 Re-enable -disk caching (accidentally disabled #457) (#475)

title: httr 1.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-08-16

title: httr 1.3.0
text: Deprecated safe_callback() removed. is_interactive argument init_oauth1.0(), init_oauth2.0() oauth_listener() deprecated, R session actually need interactive.

title: httr 1.3.0
text: New set_callback() get_callback() set query callback functions called right performing HTTP request (@gaborcsardi, #409) RETRY() now retries error occurs request (@asieira, #404), gains two new arguments: terminate_on gives greater control status codes stop retrying. (@asieira, #404) pause_min allows sub-second delays. (Use caution! Generally default preferred.) (@r2evans) server returns HTTP status code 429 specifies retry-value, value now used instead exponential backoff jitter, unless ’s smaller pause_min. (@nielsoledam, #472)

title: httr 1.3.0
text: New oauth cache files always added .gitignore , exists, .Rbuildignore. Specifically, now happens option httr_oauth_cache = TRUE user specifies cache file name explicitly. (@jennybc, #436) oauth_encode() now handles UTF-8 characters correctly. (@yutannihilation, #424) oauth_app() allows specify redirect_url need customise . oauth_service_token() gains sub parameter can request access behalf another user (#410), accepts character vector scopes described documentation (#389). oauth_signature() now normalises URL described OAuth1.0a spec (@leeper, #435) New oauth2.0_authorize_url() oauth2.0_access_token() functions pull parts OAuth process reuse elsewhere (#457). oauth2.0_token() gains three new arguments: config_init allows supply additional config initial request. needed APIs (e.g. reddit) rate limit based user_agent (@muschellij2, #363). client_credentials, allows use OAauth2 Client Credential Grant. See RFC 6749 details. (@cderv, #384) credentials argument allows customise auth flow. advanced used (#457) is_interactive argument init_oauth1.0(), init_oauth2.0() oauth_listener() deprecated, R session need interactive.

title: httr 1.3.0
text: BROWSER() prints message telling browse URL called non-interactive session. find_cert_bundle() now correctly find cert bundle “R_HOME/etc” (@jiwalker-usgs, #386). can now send lists containing curl::form_data() body requests `encoding = “multipart”. makes possible specify mime-type individual components (#430). modify_url() recognises forms empty queries. eliminates source spurious trailing ? ?= (@jennybc, #452). length() method internal path class longer exported (#395).

title: httr 1.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2016-07-03 Fix bug new cache creation code: need check cache isn’t empty file.

title: httr 1.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-06-15

title: httr 1.2.0
text: oauth_signature() longer prepends ‘oauth_’ additional parameters. (@jimhester, #373) print() methods now invisibly return x (#355). DELETE() gains body parameter (#326). New encode = "raw" allows encoding requests bodies. New http_type() returns content/mime type request, sans parameters.

title: httr 1.2.0
text: longer uses use custom requests standard POST requests (#356, #357). side-effect properly following redirects POST, fixing login issues (eg hadley/rvest#133). Long deprecated multipart argument POST(), PUT() PATCH() removed. cross-session OAuth cache now created permission 0600, give better error can’t created (#365). New RETRY() function allows retry request multiple times succeeds (#353). default user agent string now computed cached. small performance improvement, important local connections (#322, @richfitz). oauth_callback() gains trailing slash facebook compatibility (#324). progress() gains con argument control progress bar rendered (#359). use_basic_auth option used obtain token, token refreshes now use basic authentication . Suppress unhelpful “encoding supplied: defaulting UTF-8.” printing response (#327). auto parser functions now consistent arguments. fixes problem ... pass another function (#330). parse_media() can parse multiple parameters (#362, #366). Correctly cast config POST(). Fix readfunction close connection done.

title: httr 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-01-28

title: httr 1.1.0
text: stop_for_status(), warn_for_status() (new) message_for_status() replace message argument new task argument optionally describes current task. allows API wrappers provide informative error messages failure (#277, #302). stop_for_status() warn_for_status() return response errors. makes easier use pipelines (#278). url_ok() url_successful() deprecated favour flexible http_error(), works urls, responses integer status codes (#299).

title: httr 1.1.0
text: oauth1.0_token() gains RSA-SHA1 signature support private_key argument (@nathangoulding, #316). oauth2.0_token() throws error fails get access token (#250) gains two new arguments: user_params allows pass arbitrary additional parameters token access endpoint acquiring refreshing token (@cornf4ke, #312) use_basic_auth allows pick use http authentication getting token (#310, @grahamrp). oauth_service_token() checks arguments correct types (#282) anways returns request object (#313, @nathangoulding). refresh_oauth2.0() checks known OAuth2.0 errors clears locally cached token presense (@nathangoulding, #315).

title: httr 1.1.0
text: httr longer bundles cacert.pem, instead relies bundle openssl. bundle used last-resort windows R <3.2.0. Switch ‘openssl’ package hashing, hmac, signatures, base64. httr longer depends stringr (#285, @jimhester). build_url() collapses vector path / (#280, @artemklevtsov). content(x) uses xml2 XML documents readr csv tsv. content(, type = "text") defaults UTF-8 encoding otherwise specified. has_content() correctly tests presence/absence body content (#91). parse_url() correctly parses urls like file:////b/c work (#309). progress() returns TRUE fix ‘progress callback must return boolean’ warning (@jeroenooms, #252). upload_file() supports large files (> 2.5 Gb) (@jeroenooms, #257).

title: httr 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2015-06-25 httr longer uses RCurl package. Instead uses curl package, modern binding libcurl written Jeroen Ooms (#172). make httr reliable prevent “easy handle already used multi handle” error. change shouldn’t affect code uses httr - changes happened behind scenes. oauth_listener can now listen custom IP address port (previously hardwired ip:port 127.0.0.1:1410 now just default). permits authentication work settings, inside docker containers (require localhost uses 0.0.0.0 instead). configure, set system environmental variables HTTR_LOCALHOST HTTR_PORT respectively (@cboettig, #211). POST(encode = 'json') now automatically turns length-1 vectors json scalars. prevent automatic “unboxing”, wrap vector () (#187). POST(), PUT() PATCH() now drop NULL body elements. convenient consistent behaviour url query params.

title: httr 1.0.0
text: cookies argument handle() deprecated - cookies always turned default. brew_dr() renamed httr_dr() - ’s ’ve first place! content(type = "text") compares encodings case-insensitive manner (#209). context(type = "auto") uses better strategy text based formats (#209). allow encoding argument work reliably. config() now cleans duplicated options (#213). Uses CURL_CA_BUNDLE environment variable look cert bundle Windows (#223). safe_callback() deprecated - ’s longer needed curl. POST() PUT() now clean uploading single file (@mtmorgan). proxy() gains auth argument allows pick type http authentication used proxy (#216). VERB() gains body encode arguments can generate arbitrary requests body. tumblr added oauth_endpoint.

title: httr 0.6.1
text: CRAN release: 2015-01-01 Correctly parse headers multiple :, thanks @mmorgan (#180). content(), type provided function specified headers, can’t guess type extension, now assume ’s application/octet-stream (#181). Throw error timeout() less 1 ms (#175). Improved LinkedIn OAuth demo (#173).

title: httr 0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2014-12-13

title: httr 0.6.0
text: New write_stream() allows process response server stream raw vectors (#143). Suport Google OAuth2 service accounts. (#119, thanks help @siddharthab). VERB() allows use custom http verbs (#169). New handle_reset() allow reset handle get error “easy handle already used multi handle” (#112). Uses R6 instead RC. makes possible extend OAuth classes outside httr (#113). Now set capath Windows - system defaults linux mac ox seem adequate (cases better). ’ve added couple tests ensure continues work future.

title: httr 0.6.0
text: vignette("api-packages") gains detailed instructions setting environment variables, thanks @jennybc. Add revoke_all() revoke stored tokens (possible) (#77). Fix OAuth 2 process using options(httr_oob_default = TRUE) (#126, @WillemPaling). New brew_dr() checks common problems. Currently checks libCurl uses NSS. unlikely work gives advice fix problem (thanks @eddelbuettel debugging problem). Content-Type set title case avoid errors servers correctly implement case insensitivity header names. (#142, #146) thanks Håkon Malmedal (@hmalmedal) Jim Hester (@jimhester). Correctly parse http status contains two components (#162). Correctly parse http headers field name followed amount (including none) white space. Default “Accepts” header set application/json, text/xml, application/xml, */*: slightly increase likelihood getting xml back. application/xml correctly converted text parsed XML::xmlParse() (#160). Make possible override content type set POST() sending data (#140). New safe_callback() function operator makes R functions safe use RCurl callbacks (#144). Added support passing oauth1 tokens URL instead headers (#145, @bogstag). Default --band credential exchange httpuv isn’t installed. (#168)

title: httr 0.6.0
text: new_token() removed - always internal function never using . , switch creating tokens directly. Deprecate guess_media(), instead use mime::guess_type() (#148).

title: httr 0.5
text: CRAN release: 2014-09-02 can now save response bodies directly disk using write_disk() config. useful want capture large files don’t fit memory (#44). Default accept header now “application/json, text/xml, /” - encourage servers send json xml know . httr_options() allows easily filter options, e.g.  httr_options("post") POST() now specifies Curl options precisely Curl know’s ’re POST can respond appropriately redirects.

title: httr 0.5
text: Preliminary experimental support caching cache_info() rerequest() (#129). aware API likely change future. parse_http_date() parses http dates according RFC2616 spec. Requests now print time made. Mime type application/xml automatically parsed `XML::xmlParse(). (#128)

title: httr 0.5
text: Now possible specify handle url making request. content(type = "text") uses readBin() instead rawToChar() strings embedded NULLs (e.g. WINDOWS-1252) can re-encoded UTF-8. DELETE() now returns body request (#138). headers() now generic method response objects. parse_media() failed take account media types case-insenstive - lead bad re-encoding content-types like “text/html; Charset=UTF-8” Typo broke set_cookies() fixed @hrbrmstr. url_ok() works correctly now, instead always returning FALSE, bug since version 0.4 (#133). Remove redundant arguments simplifyDataFrame simplifyMatrix json parser.

title: httr 0.4
text: CRAN release: 2014-07-28

title: httr 0.4
text: New headers() cookies() functions extract headers cookies responses. Previoulsy internal status_code() function now exported extract status_code() responses. POST(), PUT(), PATCH() now use encode argument determine list inputs encoded. Valid values “multiple”, “form” “json”. multipart argument now deprecated (#103). can stream single file disk upload_file("path/"). mime type guessed extension, can supplied explicitly second argument upload_file(). progress() display progress bar, useful ’re large uploads downloads (#17). verbose() now uses custom debug function can see exactly data sent server. Arguments control exactly included, defaults selected helpful common cases (#102). with_verbose() makes easier see verbose information http requests made within functions (#87).

title: httr 0.4
text: New quickstart vignette help get running httr. New api-packages vignette describes best practices follow writing R packages wrap web APIs. httr_options() lists known config options, translating short R names full libcurl names. curl_doc() helper function allows jump directly online documentation option.

title: httr 0.4
text: authenticate() now defaults type = "basic" pretty much type authentication anyone uses. Updated cacert.pem version 2014-04-22 (#114). content_type(), content_type_xml() content_type_json() make easier set content type POST requests (requests body). has_content() tells request content associated (#91). Add is_interactive() parameter oauth_listener(), init_oauth1.0() init_oauth2.0() (#90). oauth_signature() oauth_header() now exported make easier construct custom authentication APIs use components full OAuth process (e.g. 2 legged OAuth). NULL query parameters now dropped automatically. print()ing response, httr attempt print first lines ’s text format (.e. either main type text application/json). also truncate line fits screen - hopefully make easier see little bit content, without filling screen gibberish. new_bin() removed: ’s easier see ’s going examples httpbin.org.

title: httr 0.4
text: user_agent() overrides default (closes #97) parse(type = "auto") returns NULL content associated request (#91). Better strategy resetting Curl handles prevents carry-error status problems (#112). set_config() with_config() now work tokens (#111).

title: httr 0.3
text: CRAN release: 2014-03-20

title: httr 0.3
text: OAuth 2.0 recieved major overhaul version. authentication dance now works environments (including RStudio), generally little faster. working remote server, R’s internet connection constrained ways, can now use --band authentication, copying pasting browser R session. OAuth tokens endpoints regularly expire access tokens can now refreshed, refresh automatically authentication failure. httr now uses project (working directory) based caching: every time create refresh token, copy credentials saved .httr-oauth. can override default individual tokens cache parameter, globally httr_oauth_cache option. Supply either logical vector (TRUE = always cache, FALSE = never cache, NA = ask), string (path cache file). include cache file source code control - , delete , reset access token corresponding web interface. help, httr automatically add appropriate entries .gitignore .Rbuildignore. changes mean ever authenticate per project, can authenticate environment can run R. big thanks go Craig Citro (@craigcitro) google, contributed much code many ideas make possible. OAuth token objects now reference classes, mean can updated place, access token expires needs refreshed. can manually refresh calling $refresh() object. can force reinitialisation (complete dance scratch) calling $reinit(force = TRUE). signed OAuth2 request fails 401 credentials refresh_token, OAuth token automatically refreshed (#74). OAuth tokens cached locally file called .httr-oauth (unless opt ). file included source code control, httr automatically add .gitignore .Rbuildignore. caching policy described detail help Token class. OAuth2 dance can now performed without running local webserver (#33, thanks @craigcitro). make default, set options(httr_oob_default = TRUE). useful running R remotely. Add support passing oauth2 tokens headers instead URL, make default (#34, thanks @craigcitro). OAuth endpoints can store arbitrary extra urls. Use httpuv webserver OAuth dance instead built-httpd server (#32, thanks @jdeboer). makes dance work Rstudio, also seems little faster. Rook longer required. oauth_endpoints() includes popular OAuth endpoints.

title: httr 0.3
text: HTTP verbs (GET(), POST() etc) now pass unnamed arguments config() named arguments modify_url() (#81). placement ... POST(), PATCH() PUT() tweaked must always specify body multipart arguments full name. always recommended practice; now enforced. httr includes copy cacert.pem, recent version included RCurl (#67). Added default user agent includes versions Curl, RCurl httr. Switched jsonlite rjson. Content parsers longer load packages search path. stop_for_status() now raises errors useful classes can use tryCatch() take different actions depending type error. See http_condition() details. httr now imports methods package works called Rscript. New automatic parsers mime types text/tab-separated-values text/csv (#49) Add support fragment url building/parsing (#70, thanks @craigcitro). can suppress body entirely POST(), PATCH() PUT() body = FALSE.

title: httr 0.3
text: supply multiple headers name, value recently set header always used. Urls missing query param values (e.g. http://x.com/?q=) now parsed correctly (#27). names query params now also escaped unescaped correctly parsing building urls. Default html parser now XML::htmlParse() easier use xpath (#66).

title: httr 0.2
text: CRAN release: 2012-10-11 OAuth now uses custom escaping function guaranteed work platforms (Fixes #21) concatenating configs, concatenate headers. (Fixes #19) export hmac_sha1 since many authentication protocols need content automatically guess type output (parsed, text raw) based content-type header. also automatically converts text content UTF-8 (using charset media type) can guess mime type extension server doesn’t supply one. Media type encoding can overridden type encoding arguments respectively. response objects automatically print content type aid debugging. text_content become context(, "text") parsed_content content(, "parsed"). previous calls deprecated removed future version. oauth_listener, use existing httpd port help server already started. allows ouath authentication dance work ’re RStudio. (Fixes #15). add several functions related checking status http request. : status, url_ok url_success well stop_for_status warn_for_status. build_url: correctly add params back full url.

title: httr 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2012-06-19 Add new default config: use standard SSL certificate Add recommendation use custom handles authenticate
